Material used.Description: PINK1 fusion proteins were expressed in Escherichia coli BL21 (DE3)[cite: 54]. Cells were grown at 37°C until the OD600 reached 0.7–0.8 and then were induced with isopropyl β-D-thiogalactopyranoside to a final concentration of 0.2 mM at 37°C for 3 h[cite: 55]. Cells were harvested and lysed by sonication on ice in lysis buffer containing 50 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.4), 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 1 mM DTT, 0.1%, Triton X-100, and protease inhibitors[cite: 56]. After centrifugation for 20 min at 12,000 g, the supernatant was incubated with Glutathione Sepharose 4B beads (Amersham Pharmacia Biosciences) overnight at 4°C[cite: 57]. The beads were washed extensively with lysis buffer and prepared for SDS/PAGE by addition of 2× SDS sample buffer and then heating at 95°C for 5 min[cite: 58].

Readout description.Result Description: G309D had somewhat decreased activity (60.5% of wild type; P = 0.01)[cite: 134].
L347P had drastically decreased activity (<10% of wild type)[cite: 134]. Recombinant L347P GST-PINK1 fusions were unstable[cite: 135].

Biological replicates.Description: Differences in autophosphorylation activity between different recombinant proteins (n = 3) were analyzed by using ANOVA with Fisher’s PLSD post hoc test[cite: 64, 112, 113].

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 (lane 1) is shown for comparison with artificial kinase mutants[cite: 111]. Autophosphorylation activity of wild-type PINK1 GST-fusion proteins[cite: 107].

Basic negative control.Description: Artificial kinase-dead mutant (K219A, D362A, D384A, triple kinase-dead mutant)[cite: 111].

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA with Fisher’s PLSD post hoc test [cite: 64, 113]

Material used.Description: COS7 or M17 (human neuroblastoma) cells were grown in Opti-MEM supplemented with 10% (vol/vol) FBS (Invitrogen) and were transiently transfected by using FuGENE (Roche Applied Science, Indianapolis)[cite: 51, 52]. Proteins resolved on SDS/PAGE were blotted as described in refs. 11 and 23[cite: 65]. Antibodies used were monoclonal anti-GFP (clones 7.1 and 13.1, Roche Applied Science), anti-myc (clone 9E10, Roche Applied Science), and anti-β-actin (clone AC15, Sigma)[cite: 66]. Blots were imaged by using a Storm phosphorimager, and the relative intensity of immunoreactive bands was measured by using IMAGEQUANT 5.2 and normalized to β-actin[cite: 67].

Readout description.Result Description: No effect was noted for G309D constructs[cite: 167]. G309D PINK1, however, appeared to be normally localized[cite: 174].

The amount of transfected PINK1 was drastically decreased by using the L347P mutant[cite: 164]. Quantification showed that there was a very dramatic decrease in the amount of L347P protein[cite: 165]. The level of L347P protein was significantly (P < 0.01) less than that of wild type or other constructs when measuring either preprotein or mature protein[cite: 166]. L347P PINK1 gave much lower levels of immunostaining, especially for the C-terminal constructs[cite: 173].

Biological replicates.Description: All data represent the means ± SEM from at least triplicate determinations[cite: 68]. We quantified both protein and mRNA expression for all constructs from n = 3 experiments[cite: 182].

Material used.Description: Total RNA was isolated from cells 48 h after transfection by using TRIzol (Invitrogen)[cite: 74]. The isolated RNA was treated with a DNase I (Invitrogen), and 1-µg quantities of total RNA were reverse transcribed separately with SuperScript III reverse transcriptase (Invitrogen) by using oligo(dT) primers[cite: 75]. cDNA templates were diluted 10-fold before use in RT-PCR[cite: 76]. Primers for PINK1 were 5'-AGACGCTTGCAGGGCTTTC-3' (forward) and 5'-GGCAATGTAGGCATGGTGG-3' (reverse)[cite: 76]. Primers for β-actin were 5'-AGAAGGATTCCTATGTGGGCG-3' (forward) and 5'-CATGTCGTCCCAGTTGGT-GAC-3' (reverse)[cite: 77]. Real-time quantitative PCR was performed and analyzed by using the Applied Biosystems 7900 system as described in ref. 25[cite: 78].

Readout description.Result Description: No effect was noted for G309D constructs[cite: 167]. There were no statistically significant differences between mRNA levels (P = 0.23 by ANOVA; n = 3)[cite: 166].
mRNA levels were not decreased for L347P mutant[cite: 165]. There were no statistically significant differences between mRNA levels (P = 0.23 by ANOVA; n = 3)[cite: 166].

Biological replicates.Description: We quantified both protein and mRNA expression for all constructs from n = 3 experiments[cite: 182].

Material used.Description: Cos-7 cells were transiently transfected with GFP-tagged PINK1[cite: 69]. Forty-eight hours after transfection, cells were starved in methionine/cysteine-free DMEM (Gibco-BRL) plus 1% L-glutamine for 1 h[cite: 69]. Cells were then exposed to 500 µCi (1 Ci = 37 GBq) of [35S]Met/[35S]Cys (Amersham Pharmacia Biosciences) per well for 3 h, rinsed three times with warm PBS, and chased in complete medium containing 1% L-glutamine, 2 mM L-methionine, 2 mM L-cysteine, and 10% FCS for various times up to 8 h[cite: 70]. Cells were lysed in buffer containing 150 mM NaCl, 5 mM EDTA, 50 mM Tris (pH 7.6), 0.25% Nonidet P-40, 1 mM PMSF, and protease inhibitors[cite: 71]. Transfected proteins were immunoprecipitated by using anti-GFP conjugated to agarose (Vector Laboratories), and products were eluted with sample buffer and separated by SDS/PAGE[cite: 72]. After electrophoresis, the gel was fixed (isopropyl alcohol/water/acetic acid, 25:65:10), enhanced with Amplify (Amersham Pharmacia Biosciences) for 30 min, and dried for autoradiography on a Storm PhosphorImager[cite: 73].

Readout description.Result Description: The half-life of wild-type N-terminal GFP-tagged PINK1 was ≈2 h, whereas the L347P mutation had a half-life of 0.25 h[cite: 171].

Biological replicates.Description: Similar estimates of stability were obtained in duplicate experiments[cite: 188].

Material used.Description: Cells were stained with MitoTracker (Molecular Probes) and transfected PINK1 as described in refs. 11 and 23 for DJ-1, except that primary antibodies were either anti-GFP or anti-myc (both at 1:200 dilution)[cite: 81, 82]. GFP-tagged PINK1 was observed directly in transfected cells without fixation[cite: 157]. For myc-tagged PINK1, after fixation, myc staining was revealed by using anti-myc monoclonal antibody (green in f and i) and compared with MitoTracker (red in g and h)[cite: 124].

Readout description.Result Description: G309D PINK1, however, appeared to be normally localized [cite: 174] and, like wild-type or kinase-dead proteins, was present in cytosolic inclusions in some cells[cite: 174].
Consistent with the lower steady-state levels of protein observed by using blotting, L347P PINK1 gave much lower levels of immunostaining, especially for the C-terminal constructs[cite: 173].

Biological replicates.Description: Each image is representative of at least three experiments performed in duplicate for each construct[cite: 127].

Technical replicates.Description: Each image is representative of at least three experiments performed in duplicate for each construct[cite: 127].

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used for localization studies[cite: 176].

Basic negative control.Description: Untransfected cells were shown as a control[cite: 122]. Kinase-dead PINK1 was used as a control[cite: 172].
